action.action-desc: Ms. Porter (for herself, Ms. Titus, Ms. Scanlon, Ms. Schakowsky, Ms. Tlaib, Ms. Norton, and Mr. Jones) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 28, United States Code, to prohibit the exclusion of individuals from service on a Federal jury on account of disability.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Disabled Jurors Nondiscrimination Act.

section.header: Exclusion from Federal juries on account of disability

subsection.text: Section 1862 of title 28, United States Code, is amended by inserting disability, after origin,.
Section 1865 of title 28, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
No person may be disqualified from serving on grand and petit juries in the district court under paragraph (2) or (3) of subsection (b) on account of disability.
